result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violations of foreclosure consultants - misdemeanor, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 846.45(4).
  • Violations of foreclosure consultants - misdemeanor, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 846.45(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert L Harris in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Robert L Harris in custody.  Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Sentencing hearing continued.  Continued statements by defense counsel and defendant.

Defendant Robert L Harris in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Robert L Harris in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements by the State and partial statements by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for continued sentencing to 1:30 pm.

BRANCH 47 FOR BRANCH 24
Received, Filed, and Forwarded; Notice of Hearing and Order to Produce and Transport with cover letter.

Attorney Colin McGinn requested a plea/sentencing date.  The defendant needs to be produced from the Wisconsin State Prison System.  Attorney McGinn will notify AGA Angelina Gabriele of the scheduled court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled on June 30, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.
State's Discovery Demand received and filed.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Robert L Harris not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Status conference conducted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Robert L Harris not in court, in custody.  Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel is waiting on discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Assignment & Appearance of Counsel.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lucinda S

Defendant Robert L Harris in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Robert L Harris in custody.  Eric D. Defort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
